intro: Acetosella adenophylla, commonly known as the hairy sorrel, is a small herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance and contributing to its common name. Acetosella adenophylla is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental qualities as well as its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
